bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 108 (Friday, June 24, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. NEGUSE:H.R. 8231.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8[Page H5919]

item.title: United States Innovation and Competition Act of 2021

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

summary.text:
STEM Pathways Through College Act

This bill requires the Department of Education to award competitive grants to eligible entities for increasing the number of students accessing and completing postsecondary STEM (i.e., science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) pathways.

Eligible entity refers to a partnership between the state educational agency, one or more local educational agencies, and the state public higher education system. The partnership may also include other entities, such as businesses and nonprofit organizations.

bill.title: STEM Pathways Through College Act

item.title: To authorize a grant program to support equitable access to postsecondary STEM pathways.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
